messages.content: I love living in Cambridge. It's been my home for over 30 years. I have a deep understanding of the city's values and its unique identity. It's where my wife, Edie, and I first met and chose to put down roots. We've made lots of memories here like trips with the kids to Midsummer Fair or watching the Christmas lights being switched on in the Market Square.
I hope we all have a common determination to change our city and our country for the better. That's why I'm standing to be your next MP.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Stopping Brexit is my number one priority. Brexit goes against the values I hold dear: openness, internationalism, and diversity.

mentions.partyLeader: Time and time again, residents tell me they cannot vote for a Labour MP whose party leader has decided, yet again, to sit on the fence.

issues.brexitEurope: Stopping Brexit is my number one priority. Brexit goes against the values I hold dear: openness, internationalism, and diversity.
